title: PeoplePlus
text:
PeoplePlus is a recruitment and training provider based in <a href="Birmingham">Birmingham</a>, <a href="United%20Kingdom">United Kingdom</a> The company runs a range of frontline public services including <a href="employability">employability</a> support, <a href="adult%20skills%20training">adult skills training</a>, <a href="apprenticeships">apprenticeships</a>, <a href="independent%20living">independent living</a>, and <a href="prison%20education">prison education</a> as well as offering recruitment and training for employers.
PeoplePlus is owned by Staffline Group PLC, the UK’s largest outsourced workforce provider with a turnover in excess of £1.1bn in 2018.
History.
In 2011, Staffline Group acquired EOS, a small work programme provider in the West Midlands. This was followed in 2014 with the acquisition of Avanta, one of the largest prime work programme providers in the UK, and finally in 2015 the purchase of another prime provider <a href="A4e">A4e</a>. In 2015 the 3 companies were merged to form PeoplePlus.
Simon Rouse was appointed Group MD in November 2017. Simon’s previous career spans senior leadership roles across financial services and business services with Barclays, Santander and Capita, as well as leadership roles in the NHS.
In 2018, PeoplePlus made a further acquisition of <a href="LearnDirect">LearnDirect</a> Apprenticeships, making them the largest <a href="apprenticeship">apprenticeship</a> provider in the UK.
Current Operations.
PeoplePlus delivers government contracts in apprenticeships, enterprise, justice, adult education and community services, as well as providing corporate solutions to private clients in the fields of wellbeing, learning, development and talent recruitment. 
Employability.
In England and Wales, PeoplePlus were the largest prime provider of <a href="Department%20for%20Work%20and%20Pensions">DWP</a>’s Work Programme before it ended in 2019. In 2018 they began delivering Fair Start Scotland in Glasgow and Highlands & Islands - a voluntary programme with support to develop soft skills and find sustainable employment.
Apprenticeships.
Following the acquisition of LearnDirect Apprenticeships in 2018, PeoplePlus became the largest provider of apprenticeships in the UK.
Enterprise.
PeoplePlus enterprise services provide training and advice for starting a business or becoming self employed.
HR Business Solutions.
PeoplePlus HR Business Solutions division advertises themselves as 'providing support to employers in attracting, developing and retaining workforces, using technology and data analysis to track impact and provide a measurable return on investment.' 
They also write 'A Health and <a href="Well-being">Well-being</a> division brings together a range of services to proactively address and improve well-being in the workplace. This includes diagnostics and creating action and support plans for a business, delivering relevant training and events, healthy office guidance, absence management services, <a href="Occupational%20safety%20and%20health">occupational health</a> and <a href="physiotherapy">physiotherapy</a>.' 
Adult Education.
Adult skills programmes delivered across England provide unemployed people with the skills for employment. Qualifications delivered include <a href="Health%20and%20Social%20Care">Health and Social Care</a>, Retail, Security, Warehousing and Distribution, Forklift Truck Driving, <a href="Customer%20service">Customer Service</a>, <a href="Hospitality">Hospitality</a>, <a href="Engineering">Engineering</a>, Catering, Functional Skills, and IT. 
Justice.
In 2019 PeoplePlus more than doubled its prison education services with additional contracts worth £100m and now provide education services in 22 prisons in Britain.
The company also delivers rehabilitation services through the Community Rehabilitation Company in partnership with Warwickshire and <a href="West%20Mercia%20Police">West Mercia Police</a> working directly with offenders to tackle the causes of offending behaviour and reduce re-offending.
